page.title: 02CONTINUED
page.content:
year, just before her l0lst birthday
she died.On the fountain there is a plaque to commemorate her centenary. Set back from the war memorial is the village hall. Many clubs meet here from Brownies to the Over sixties. The floor has a badminton court painted on it. You can hire the village hall for parties and dances and also for coffee mornings and jumble sales. Once upon a time there were fourteen pubs but now there are only four. The reason for the decrease is that river traffic declined and because there no more bargemen the pub trade was not required. Now we have three grocers'shops, a butcher and a post office store. You can buy newspapers from one of the garages. The fish and chip shop is open three nights a week.
